intro: Silene liponeura, commonly known as the purple sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. Silene liponeura is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
